snippet: Nicolas Sarkozy’s first week as leader of the Union for a Popular Movement Party seemed to prove only that he had determined rivals within the party and was not assured of becoming its presidential candidate.
abstract: Former French Pres Nicolas Sarkozy, as leader of conservative Union for a Popular Movement Party, hopes to become its presidential candidate for 2017, but his rivals within the party have other plans; Alain Juppe regularly beats Sarkozy in countrywide popularity polls, and he has his own political aspirations.

byline.original: By SUZANNE DALEY and AURELIEN BREEDEN

lead_paragraph: Nicolas Sarkozy’s first week as leader of the Union for a Popular Movement Party seemed to prove only that he had determined rivals within the party and was not assured of becoming its presidential candidate.

headline.main: Eyeing Return, Ex-President in France Has Hurdles
headline.print_headline: Eyeing Return, Ex-President in France Has Hurdles
